title: Updated Client Switchover: Out with the Old, In with the New
body:
Hey everyone,

Let's cut right to the chase, the AIR client (more recently called the legacy or old client) will officially be disabled and turned off on April 24th. For more information on what the updated client offers and why we’re making this change, [check out this article](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/legacy-client-officially-retires-april-24). This means that if you try to launch the old client on the 24th, you will immediately be prompted to switch over to the new Updated Client.  You’ll get a notification that looks like this: 

http://i.imgur.com/mUT2GB5.png

We’ve been preparing for this on the backend for a long time, so there shouldn’t be too much you need to download when the switchover happens.  Once everything is set, you should be able to login normally. We ***_strongly encourage_*** you to switch over starting now!  That way if you do hit a problem we can get it resolved while the AIR client is still there as a back-up!

We know that with any change there is always a risk of some unforeseen bugs and errors that may crop up.  The following issues are some of the most common that pop-up with their solutions:

*NOTE:  You may want to [temporarily disabling your Firewall](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq3) before switching over to the Updated Client, and re-enabling it the moment its finished. This should help the switchover go smoothly.*

>#***Important notice regarding Rune Pages***

We're investigating an issue with rune pages not saving correctly when re-arranged or have special characters in its name.  While we work on a more permanent resolution, our tech team can help with a fix.  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) if you're impacted.  

>#***Why does the End of Game Stats screen take FOREVER to freakin' load?!***

This might be due to the "Close Client During Game" option in the client.  This option makes the client close out when you enter a game, which means after the game it has to completely reboot to start.  Low Spec Mode should be enough to keep things running smoothly, so disable this option by entering the client, clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner, a[nd unchecking the box.](http://i.imgur.com/smwR8be.png)

>#***“I’ve tried the Updated Client before, and it was sooooo laggy”***

 We've made some massive changes to the Updated Client make it run as smoothly as possible, even on the proudest of potatoes.  Enable Low Spec Mode if it isn’t on already.  You can find out by clicking the gear in the upper right hand corner of the Updated Client and then [click "Enable Low Spec Mode"](http://i.imgur.com/rPGRnYW.png)

>#***"Patching Failed and we're not sure why Error: 004"***

This error usually occurs when Operating System Permissions isn't set properly.  Essentially, the patcher is trying to access files found on your hard drive, but it is being denied from doing so.  [Follow the steps in this guide to get this resolved!](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

>#***"Something's up with our servers and it's preventing you from patching" Error: 003***

Occurs when the patcher isn't able to maintain a stable connection with our Patcher Servers.  If the patcher loses connection to the server to get the necessary files, it will simply stop working.  To get this resolved, [make sure to complete all of the solutions in this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

--------------------------------------

If you have a problem that isn’t here or those solutions aren’t working, drop a comment below and we’ll be sure to respond and help you out!  ^.^

Hey Mic Man,

It sucks to hear that, I've tried out the Updated Client since... well for a bit now and there has been rough patches when it came to resources, but our developers definitely did a lot to optimize it. I understand that you want a smaller footprint on your computer's resources; just because something is new doesn't mean it's better unless it delivers something worth upgrading towards--like features and utilizing less resources.

I've tested this on my system at home, at work, and even one of the test machines we have, but they've all told roughly the same story (just launched, logged in, waited ~5 minutes, no games played):

* **Legacy Client**: 3 processes - 
678,564K + 2,948K + 5,772K = **687,284K**
* **Updated Client** (Normal Mode): 4 processes - 
66,268K + 47,436K + 234,536K + 61,468K = **409,708K**
* **Updated Client** (Low Spec Mode): 4 processes - 
65,612K + 58,912K + 59,088K + 217,704K = **401,316K
**

If you're seeing something drastically different, I definitely want to know what you're on your Task Manager and get down to why it's taking up resources differently than we expected; we can pass what you're seeing along so we can get to the bottom of it.
Did you also try playing a game or 2 and then looking at the memory usage? Lol client has been known to continually eat more and more memory for me.

> [{quoted}](name=xMichaelx3,realm=EUW,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=uTqoJzoE,comment-id=00040001000000020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-04-18T22:33:46.733+0000)
>
> Did you also try playing a game or 2 and then looking at the memory usage? Lol client has been known to continually eat more and more memory for me.

That's a great question, in the example, I definitely didn't do that. So when I got home, I booted up my notebook and started playing Coop v AI Games to see what results I got (and yes, I died in a few of those games... to bots). This is the test format I came up with:
Clean Launch > Login > Wait 1-2 minutes > Played 1 Coop v AI Game > Home > Store > Clicked on each Store tab > Loot > Profile > Home > Played 1 Coop v AI Game > Home > Wait 1-2 minutes.

Here are the results I got:
**Legacy Client**: 3 processes -
640,208K + 848K + 2,272K = **643,328K**
**Updated Client** (Normal Mode): 4 processes -
36,604K + 38,256K + 23,604K + 321,036K = **416,500K**
**Updated Client** (Low Spec Mode): 4 processes -
40,924K + 37,772K + 16,388K + 310,016K = **405,100K**

_Note:_ My notebook at home has different specs than the desktop I use at work.

Interestingly, between my notebook at home and desktop at work, there's an increase in resource usage with the Updated Client in both Normal and Low Spec Modes, but they're still both lower than with the Legacy Client. I imagine there are quite a few variables besides just specs that go into play here.

Slimofq, thanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us and the experiences you’ve had so far with the client.  I wanted to let you know that we’ve received your ticket, and our tech team will be reaching out to you with a fix.  Even though this might be your first post, you’ve seen a lot of shit since Season 1 and still today you help the community with bug reports and being a stand-up summoner.  Don’t think for a moment that we’re just going to let you or anyone else behind just because we’re moving to an improved platform.  You’re coming with us!  

First and foremost, I’ll be updating the thread with info regarding this rune page error.  We’ve been tracking this, and while investigating have found that it might be caused through a combination of re-arranging rune pages or using special characters in the name.  Our tech guys will be manually fixing this up for you in your ticket!  I don’t have any eta on a more permanent fix, but it’s on our radar.
 
The lag issues you’re mentioning could certainly be an issue with the client, but to be honest it sounds like an unstable connection to me.   More specifically, the delays in selecting masteries/spells and invisible teammates sounds a lot like your connection to champion select could be degrading. Your network settings might be optimized for the legacy client, but the updated version is a different application that could use some tweaking. Just to help rule out that possibility, the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide has some solid steps to tune things up.  If not, let your specialist know in your ticket and we’ll go from there!

You’ve offered so much already and it means a lot, so I kind of went into an ‘omg fix it mode’ to tackle as much as we could here.  Thanks for letting us hear your voice.   _Hug_
